instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot loop with battery installed only
threads.message: I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no liquid damage, it overheated during an update that failed, I have tried two new batteries the problem persists. This only happens with the battery in. on charger only battery unconnected the computer boots and runs normally. If the battery is connected after boot the computer will blackscreen and immediately start bootlooping, constantly chiming over and over again, no apple symbol.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot loop with battery installed only
threads.message:
Post exact voltage at F7040/41 and pins 9 & 15 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, with both charger and battery connected.
Can you acces OSX botting in SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot loop with battery installed only
threads.message:
F7040: 12.56
F7041: 12.56

with machine off:
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
pin 9: 30.7 mv
pin 15: 57.8 mv

while boot looping
pin 9: .410 v
pin 15: 57.5 mv

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot loop with battery installed only
threads.message: i am not sure how to even attempt an smc bypass on this model

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot loop with battery installed only
threads.message: Press power button, connect charger and maintain pressing 5-10s...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot loop with battery installed only
threads.message: no i cannot boot with smc bypass it just continues to loop

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot loop with battery installed only
threads.message:
"I have tried two new batteries the problem persists."
All chinese cheap batteries?
Try a known good one, even older.
Or try to test the new ones with other board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot loop with battery installed only
threads.message: both batteries work in other computers

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot loop with battery installed only
threads.message: i should note that the computer does charge the battery and if you plug it in while booted right before the crash it will appear in the top bar as recognized

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boot loop with battery installed only
threads.message: Try to run ASD EFI version...
